unit_learning_outcomes.description: Analyse survival data using the Cox proportional hazards model, including time- dependent covariates and multi-event models.
Analyse survival data using parametric models.
Demonstrate  understanding of survival data by identification and application of correct models.
Determine sample size for simple survival analysis.
Summarise and display survival data using nonparametric methods.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading supplied notes and directed reading of the textbook and journal articles.
Reviewing and participating in online discussion groups.

assessments.description: Simple analyses performed by hand to demonstrate understanding of the basic principles of survival analysis and analysis using statistical software of univariate and simple Cox models.

Full statistical analysis of a survival data set. This requires choosing an appropriate survival model, performing diagnostic tests and modifying the model to correctly satisfy the assumptions of the Cox model and presenting the results for presentation to a general audience.
Statistical analyses covering advance material including multiple events, time-dependent covariates, parametric models,  presentation of results and sample size calculations.

data.description: This unit explores biostatistical applications of survival analysis. These begin with the Kaplan-Meier curve definition and its extension to the comparison of survival of several groups of subjects. The Cox proportional hazards model is introduced as a method for handling continuous covariates and parametric accelerated failure-time models are also covered. Time-dependent covariates and multiple outcomes are also considered.
data.title: Survival Analysis

title: Survival Analysis
